title: Brown/Yellow Screen > BUGSPLAT!
body:
For some reason in-game, occasionally I am getting a brown/yellow screen.. followed by a bugsplat.

I am using a brand new computer, barely a month old.. I'm running a 4690/gtx970/8gb 1600mhz ram. 128gb mxcrucial SSD.

All my drivers are up to date.. I have ran 3dmark and heaven benchmark for a couple of hours on end, I have no issues running these benchmarks.. I have recently just re-formatted in attempt to fix this.. then its happened again.

Originally I thought it was a GPU issue as the first time It ever done it my nvidia driver crashed.. but since then I'm just getting bugsplats =\

I've contacted riot via ticket but they're basically no help.. can anyone help me with this issue?

replies.body:
Cheese has his own discussion about it, if you need context. Not sure if he's legit, though.

I presume you're using Windows. And you installed it from scratch, which is exactly what Riot develop their game for.

You have all the drivers correctly installed, the equipment is new (though there is still a possibility that the equipment was faulty from the beginning; not all distributors were made equal), or you are using Windows 10. If you are, then use your normal OS instead and wait for Windows 10 to be fully released; it's still in beta.

Do you know the conditions that cause this brown/yellow screen to occur? Do you know what makes it more likely to occur? Try running some experiments in bot games to see.

Of course, repair the client to make sure that it's not a corrupt file or something.

Best of luck.

I'm using windows 7, I can't re-produce it in bot games (it doesn't happen often, it happened once over the weekend, around 20 games)

all my drivers are up to date, I have stress tested my CPU and GPU and have had NO problems.

I havn't repaired, but I know that won't fix it as I just recently reformatted (it was happening before I formatted also, a repair didn't work then) This is a fresh install.
Well, I'm leaning towards thinking that it's a faulty graphics driver/motherboard. Do you have warranty on it?
